Key Arguments: Strong support for regulating digital platforms to combat misinformation and disinformation.
Emphasis on integrating First Nations expertise and ensuring cultural safety.
Need for transparency, accountability, and community engagement in the legislation.
Balance between freedom of speech and the right to a safe online environment.
Importance of public education and disclosure of lobbying efforts related to the legislation.
Main Themes: Cultural safety and First Nations involvement
Freedom of expression vs. safe online environment
Role of digital platforms and corporate power
Notable Quotes: Croakey asserts the importance of acknowledging the communityâ€™s right to a safe online environment in the legislation.
Freedom of expression is often used as an excuse to enable the dissemination of misinformation and disinformation, including racism and hate speech directed at particular communities.
We urge the development of a whole-of-government and whole-of-community strategy for envisioning a safe, reliable and relevant news and information system.
